description: A slide show of photographs of cultural events from this week.

title: A-List Stars Invade Digital Auteurs Space
description: The Homes

title: Representing the Republic of Lancme
description: MOVE over, spokesmodel  make way for the brand ambassador. Over the last few years, this term, conjuring up a Girl Scout sash and a certain Euro flair, has become a retail buzzword. Those tapped for the role include the model Ins de la Fressange, who represents Roger Vivier; the socialite and reality-show star Olivia Palermo, an ambassador for Mango; five downtown It girls selected by Chanel Beauty to be Les Fidles (Faithful Ones) in 2009: Jen Brill, Poppy Delevigne, Leigh Lezark, Caroline Sieber and Vanessa Traina; and Barneys Simon Doonan, who now goes by the title creative ambassador-at-large (an oblique reference to my lack of height).

title: The Mixed Benefits of Valve Throttling
description: DO valve-throttled engines pass the cost-benefit test?

title: For Better Engine Efficiency, a Different Kind of Throttle
description: EVER since the first horseless carriage roared noisily to life, some means of controlling the speed of the engine has been a necessity for safe driving.

title: When New York City Bloomed
description: Before there were skyscrapers and expensive restaurants in Manhattan, the citys wealth was measured in wild flora and fauna. Of 1,357 native plant species documented in New York Citys history, only 778 remain here. Below is a selection of plants that have vanished from the city.

title: Radiation + Cable Anchor + Science = ?
description: If you are brave enough to want to see a horrifying example of how science fares in the infotainment arena, watch the following excerpt from CNNs HLN network last Monday. The network claims to be about both news and views. I think the word news should be dropped for now.

title: Arts & Leisure Preview: The Borgias, Marvel Comics, Tough-Guy TV and More
description: Wisdom, insights and observations from this weekends Arts & Leisure section.

title: Multiplying 500 by 2 and Finding a New Answer
description: AS he set out to design a modern version of Italys peoples car, the Fiat 500, Roberto Giolito found inspiration from the man who created two iconic ancestors: the original 500 Topolino of 1936 and the new Cinquecento of 1957.

title: Differences in Regulations Delayed Arrival of the Cinquecento
description: FIATS introduction of the Nuova 500 in 1957 was a stroke of fortunate timing, a welcome bright spot for a population weary of riding bicycles, or walking, to get around postwar Europe. The designer, Dante Giacosa, working with Fiats engineers, had created an implement of affordable transportation that would become an Italian treasure.

title: NATO Takes Command of Mission
description: NATO prepared on Friday to assume leadership from the United States of the military campaign against Col. Muammar el-Qaddafis forces.

title: Yankees Collect Arms and Trust in the Market
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Instead of the signs reading Prepare and Compete that now hang above the Yankees clubhouse in this post-Steinbrenner era, perhaps there should be one trumpeting the organizations unofficial spring motto, Safety in Numbers. That became Brian Cashmans strategy after Cliff Lee signed with the Philadelphia Phillies: overwhelming Manager Joe Girardi with pitching options to get him through the early season, one trip through the rotation at a time.

title: Fox Leads Ratings
description: The judges on American Idol intervened to save Casey Abrams from elimination on Thursday as 20.7 million viewers tuned in to the results show on Fox, according to Nielsens estimates. Fox led the prime-time ratings over all, despite broadcasting a repeat of Bones at 9 p.m. (8.8 million). ABC placed second for the night, earning its best ratings at 9 for Greys Anatomy (10.1 million). At 8, ABCs Wipeout garnered 7.5 million viewers, while at 10, ABCs Private Practice drew eight million. CBS ranked third over all, averaging 7.2 million viewers for its live coverage of college basketball. NBC finished a distant fourth place as its comedy lineup continued to struggle.

title: Group That Beat Back Proposition 23 Is Reborn
description: George P. Shultz, the Republican former secretary of state, and Thomas F. Steyer, the Democratic hedge fund billionaire, are reviving the coalition that campaigned last year to defeat Proposition 23, the California ballot measure that would have derailed the states landmark global warming law.

title: Initial Costs of Libyan Intervention on Low End of Analysts Estimates
description: With fighter planes darting around at a cost of $13,000 an hour, and Tomahawk missiles worth $1.4 million apiece, lawmakers have been concerned about how much the intervention in Libya could cost the Pentagon.

title: Sentence of the Week, Round Four
description: This weeks tweets organized themselves spontaneously around a little theme: gender. I am therefore going to dedicate this edition of Shamblandersons Sentence of the Week to the memory of James Thurber, the poet laureate of the tragicomic battle between men and women. The winner of this weeks contest will be whichever of the sentences works best as a caption to this famous Thurber cartoon.

title: Europe to Test Safety of Nuclear Reactors
description: BRUSSELS  After a week of bickering over the future of nuclear power, European Union leaders reached one point of agreement Friday as they decided that reactors across all 27 member nations should undergo safety tests in response to the continuing radiation leaks from a beleaguered plant in Japan.

title: Looking Back | Oman Fashion Week
description: The Sultanate of Oman occupies the corner of the Arabian Peninsula nearest India, and lies between Dubai and Yemen. In broad strokes, this is a fair social description as well as geographical. The ancient city of Muscat is picturesquely nestled among a craggy collection of low mountains that run right into the sea. The bare rocky massifs yield occasionally to sandy beaches and the deep natural harbors that have made the city a hub of Indian Ocean trade for thousands of years.

title: Succumbing to Temptation (and the Devil) in a Quest for Money
description: Histoire du Soldat should be read, played and danced, wrote its composer, Stravinsky, and its author, Charles-Ferdinand Ramuz, when the work was first performed in Lausanne, Switzerland, in 1918. And although the piece is often presented as a musical suite, those instructions have frequently been taken to heart. With its crisp narrative  a soldier sells his violin (and thus his soul) to the Devil, fights to win it back, but ultimately loses it again  its dance-rich, jazz-influenced melodies; and its dramatic text, Soldat (The Soldiers Tale) offers abundant collaborative possibilities.

title: Is It Time for the Bulls to Spend Serious Money?
description: In a recent piece, Rob Mahoney made the case that the Chicago Bulls are legitimate championship contenders. Sitting astride the Eastern Conference, and breaking the 50-win barrier before the 20-loss one, the Bulls have proven that they can beat all comers. The only team they have not beaten this season is the Knicks, whom they still have one more game against.

title: Interview With a Pro-Saleh Demonstrator
description: A Yemeni man says that protests should stop, as President Ali Abdullah Saleh's plans to hold elections in the fall.

title: Interview With a Anti-Saleh Demonstrator
description: A Yemeni man says he hopes that President Ali Abdullah Saleh will hear the will of the people and leave.

title: Buffett Draws Fervent Fans in India With His Folksy Advice
description: NEW DELHI  The billionaire investor Warren E. Buffett capped off a weeklong visit to India by doing one of the things he does best, after investing  doling out folksy sayings and sensible advice to an appreciative crowd.

title: How a European Fiat Had to Change Before It Could Immigrate
description: Transforming the Fiat 500 sold in the European Union into the 2012 Nafta model required dozens of small changes. Here are some of them:

description: If prosecutorial accounts were to be believed, Monday could not have been a great day for Barry R. Bondorowsky.

title: When Banks Impose Homeowners Insurance
description: Paul Sullivan writes this week in his Wealth Matters column about something called force-placed insurance. It is the insurance that a mortgage company buys when it believes the owners of a house no longer have insurance on the property.

title: Warrens Calendars Show Limited Role in Talks on Foreclosure Settlement
description: Republican lawmakers have accused Elizabeth Warren of trying to squeeze billions of dollars out of banks that wrongly foreclosed on homeowners.

description: The fashion designer Carmen Marc Valvo and his partner, Christian Knaust, the president of Mr. Valvos couture house, were famous among their friends for hosting enormous cocktail parties in their apartment on the 28th floor of the Majestic on Central Park West. Enormous, as in 200 people on average, Mr. Knaust said.

description: You can customize almost anything online these days: chocolate M&Ms,eyeglasses, even cars.
