title: On the Street | Early Signs of Spring
description: On March 18, the season jumped the gun, and in the 77-degree heat, winter coats disappeared and spring fashion took over.

title: Millers Star Turn on The Tonight Show
description: In his story on Arizonas 93-77 victory over Duke, Sam Amick referenced an appearance that Wildcats Coach Sean Miller made on The Tonight Show with Johnny Carson when he was 14 years old. Here are a few moments from that appearance, with Miller showcasing some impressive ballhandling skills.

title: Third-Party iPad 2 Cases Take on Smart Covers
description: Although most hardware technology companies offer protective gear and cases for their gadgets, they also rely on third-party companies to create and design a variety of products. Over the last few years, partly fueled by the creation of delicate mobile devices with large flat screens, these companies have become an integral part of a products success  and a multimillion-dollar business.

title: Power of La La La and Lures of Ooh, Ooh
description: My my, it all comes rushing back so quickly. Up onstage, theres a band of foulmouthed British kids, working through the basic chords, cribbing melodies from the Beatles and the Kinks. In the audience, a bunch of Americans clamor for the hot new thing, any hot new thing. And over there, near the edge of the scrum, is Matt Pinfield, once the host of MTVs alternative-rock cluster 120 Minutes, which is returning this year with Mr. Pinfield again at the helm.

title: Triangle Fire: In Memoriam
description: At 8:15 this bright and chilly morning I set out on an unusual mission for someone with as little artistic talent as myself. With a brand new box of colored chalk in hand and joined by my daughter, Emily, I took the subway to 14th Street and First Avenue and walked to Venieros, the pastry shop, on East 11th Street, just off First Avenue.

title: How It Plays: Taking a New System Out for Several Spins
description: I have played 14 different retail games for the 3DS, the latest version of the incredibly successful handheld device from Nintendo that will be available to buy come Sunday. My eyes arent bleeding yet.

title: Nintendos New World of Games: Three Dimensions, Zero Glasses
description: Nintendos new 3DS device is quite literally like nothing you have seen before.

title: Violations Issued Against Troubled Renovation Project
description: The Apthorps decline from a celebrity rental building to one of New York Citys most troubled renovation projects took another step backward on Friday after the Department of Housing Preservation and Development issued two dozen more violations against the developers of the building.

title: Payrolls May Not Be Growing Much, but Profits Are
description: As weve noted before, todays job market woes are no longer because of layoffs. Layoffs, in fact, are at a record low. The problem today is that no one is hiring those people who were already laid off.

title: Carnegie Unveils Music Education Program
description: Clive Gillinson, in his six years as executive and artistic director of Carnegie Hall, has developed an ever more expansive view of its mission and constituency. Carnegie has increasingly ventured beyond its walls with activities including neighborhood concerts in New York, partnerships with the Juilliard School and others, and festivals with citywide and cross-country collaborations.

title: The World According to Tim Ferriss
description: AUSTIN, Tex.

title: Fearsome Fangs, for a Plant-Eater
description: Researchers in Brazil have discovered a 260-million-year-old fossil species with a fearsome array of peculiar teeth: a set running down the middle of its mouth, and ferocious canines that were never used to eat flesh.

title: Interview: Denis Villeneuve
description: Denis Villeneuve, the director of "Incendies," discusses his family drama.

title: Lung Association Ads Fault House Panel Chairman
description: The American Lung Association has opened a billboard campaign against Fred Upton, the Republican chairman of the House Commerce and Energy Committee, taking him to task for his legislative attacks on the Environmental Protection Agency and clean air regulations.

title: Less Appetite for Luxury
description: At age 23, Maki Kusaka, an office worker in Tokyo, has 10 Gucci handbags lining her wardrobe, the fruits of an obsession she has shared with countless other Japanese to collect the worlds hottest luxury brands.

title: Chic in Review | Liz Taylor, RIP
description: All the fashion news of the week thats fit to reprint.

title: An Aspiring Theme Park Mogul
description: Liens and lawsuits call into question one mans plans for a giant theme park in Tennessee.

title: Hundreds of Thousands Flee Ivory Coast Crisis, U.N. Says
description: DAKAR, Senegal  At least 700,000 people have fled their homes in Ivory Coasts main city, Abidjan, to escape the increasing violence and collapsing economy stemming from the nations political crisis, the United Nations said Friday.

title: App Smart Extra: More Office Apps
description: That didnt take long.

title: Riot Police in Jordan Clear Camp of Protesters
description: AMMAN, Jordan  Riot police officers stormed a pro-democracy rally here in the Jordanian capital on Friday, leaving one man dead, injuring scores of other people and dispersing with water cannons a 1,000-person tent camp set up the previous day to resemble Tahrir Square in Cairo.

title: A Place to Connect
description: A look inside a senior center in Rockaway Beach, one of 105 threatened with closing due to state budget cuts.

title: Suspensions Force Bishops to Reassess Rule Changes
description: Nine years after a scandal in Boston prompted Americas Roman Catholic bishops to announce sweeping policy changes to protect children from sexual abuse by priests, the bishops are scrambling to contain the damage from a growing crisis in Philadelphia that has challenged the credibility of their own safeguards.

title: Alone, Together
description: ON a raw, gray morning this month, two women sat at their usual table, eating breakfast from plastic trays. Rose Bosco, who is 95, was having oatmeal and toast, her white hair swooping magnificently back from her pale forehead. Delores Brown, 73, passed her a carton of milk and a banana to slip into her purse for later. Their shoulders touched as they leaned close in conversation.

title: Do It Yourself Pucker
description: Julia Moskin replies to a readers question about do it yourself food. A previous post dealt with canning, yogurt and other questions.

title: Newly Homeless in Japan Re-Establish Order Amid Chaos
description: RIKUZENTAKATA, Japan  Koji Yamaguchi, a 76-year-old survivor of the tsunami that all but eradicated this town on March 11, was unavailable for interviews. He was out walking his dog.

title: Wintergreen Fund Takes Aim at Consolidated-Tomoka
description: The head of the activist mutual fund Wintergreen Advisers is calling for the resignation of the chief executive of Consolidated-Tomoka, a Florida real estate company.

title: A New Script for Spider-Man: Goodbye Geeks
description: Cast members of Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark held their first organized reading on Friday of the Broadway musicals new script, which jettisons the director Julie Taymors Geek Chorus of narrators and reduces her villainess Arachne to a supporting character, according to two members of the production who attended the reading. The new script beefs up the role of another villain, the Green Goblin (right, played by Patrick Page, battling Reeve Carney as Peter Parker/Spider-Man), who proved popular with focus groups that the producers convened after the onslaught of negative reviews by theater critics. Most of the changes will be implemented during the shows hiatus, which starts April 19, according to the two production members, who would only speak anonymously because the producers do not want the changes discussed publicly. On Thursday, the producers said that the choreographer Chase Brock would stage new musical numbers. Mr. Brock, 27, is best known for his choreography on a popular video game, the Broadway Experience. He takes over from Daniel Ezralow. The producers ousted Ms. Taymor this month; Mr. Ezralow said at the time that he was directly assured that he would continue with the show. Ben Brantley, the chief theater critic of The New York Times, wrote in February that the musical may rank among the worst in Broadway history and that Mr. Ezralows choreography was pure vintage MTV.

title: Tip of the Week: Internet Radio
description: Both Windows and Mac OS X include free media jukebox programs  Windows Media Player and iTunes, respectively  but these can do more than just play digital audio files or tracks converted from compact discs. Both programs also have the ability to tap into live radio streams from around the world, which greatly multiplies your musical choices for those times when you just need a little something playing in the background.

title: The Deed Is Done, the Doers Undone
description: See that big guy over there? Almost Herculean, isnt he, with his sinewy arms and swelling chest, the kind of man you can easily imagine as a master of war and of women. But look again, closely. Theres doubt in his face, too, as if he were not always sure of what hes doing or even who he is. I bet you this Hercules could crack. You sure wouldnt want to fight him, but then you wouldnt want him on your team, either.

title: The Joys of Ping-Pong in the Open
description: Furniture makers are prone to grand claims about their designs, but few go quite as far as Alan Good. Im offering it less as an object, he says of his Henge T40 model, the institutional price of which is $3,490. Its more about the people who come by and just hang out, and watch each other. It slows down passers-by. It makes for a little lingering spot where you pause what youre doing, linger, talk with a stranger. The random rubbing of shoulders: thats how I put my table forward.

title: Move Aside, Montero and Romine, Here Comes Molina
description: TAMPA, Fla.  On the morning of Feb. 21, I posted on Twitter a tease to my article on Gustavo Molina that read, Whats it like being in Yankees camp but having a 0.0001% chance of making the team? More than a month later, I stand corrected. With less than a week until opening day, Molina, a 29-year-old with 41 major league at-bats, is edging his way into the backup catchers competition. And, if you listen closely enough to Joe Girardi, he has an edge over the prospects Jesus Montero and Austin Romine.

title: Spontaneity, Nudity and Absurdity: It Is What It Is
description: Adrienne Truscott takes being funny very seriously. In her new ha: a solo, which isnt a solo at all, she wobbles between chaotic and rigorous, casual and formal, absurd and obscene. Sometimes she and her performers fall off that high wire; sometimes they maintain impeccable balance and make you laugh out loud.

title: Three Master Composers and a Lingering Mystery
description: Three out of four pieces, an audience member said to her companion as they made their way up the aisle at Avery Fisher Hall after a concert by the New York Philharmonic on Thursday night. Thats not too bad.

title: Ochocinco Is a   Master at Twitter
description: An independent research company called Twitalizer ranked Bengals wide receiver Chad Ochocinco as the second-most influential personality on Twitter, according to David Leonhardts article on The 6th Floor blog on Thursday.

title: Obama Plans Libya Speech on Monday
description: President Obama plans to talk about the military operation in Libya on Monday evening in a nationally televised speech at the National Defense University, the White House said, offering his first formal explanation of the goals of this increasingly complex and dangerous mission.

title: In Prison for Taking a Liar Loan
description: A few weeks ago, when the Justice Department decided not to prosecute Angelo Mozilo, the former chief executive of Countrywide, I wrote a column lamenting the fact that none of the big fish were likely to go to prison for their roles in the financial crisis.

title: Secrets of the Bean Pot
description: IT used to be that whenever I whipped up a big pot of beans, Id strain the cooking liquid directly down the drain.

title: Podcast: Taxes, Debt and Regulation
description: General Electric is the biggest corporation based in the United States, and it had a very successful 2010, with billions of dollars in profits.

title: The Week in Pictures for March 25
description: Here is a slide show of photographs from the past week in New York City and the region. Subjects include Freddys bar in Brooklyn, a quilt show at the Park Avenue Armory, and the 200th anniversary of the Manhattan street grid.

title: Red Bulls Will Play With a Short Roster
description: There were plenty of good seats available on the Red Bulls bus to the airport Friday afternoon as the team traveled to Columbus, Ohio, for Saturdays M.L.S. match against the Crew.

title: War of Semantics
description: war  a state of usually open and declared armed hostile conflict between states or nations (2) : a period of such armed conflict (3) : state of war

title: Webcast by a Hip-Hopper Who Cooks
description: JERSEY CITY

title: Benefits for Japan
description: Dine Out for Japan Relief involves dozens of restaurants that have agreed to donate 5 percent of every meal through Wednesday to Japan relief efforts.

title: Sometimes a Good Defense Saves the Game
description: One of the two teams that tied for the Machlin Womens Swiss Teams last Sunday at the Spring Nationals in Louisville, Ky., was Geeske Joel of Palo Alto, Calif.; Tobi Sokolow of Austin, Tex.; Jill Levin of Henderson, Nev.; Jill Meyers of Santa Monica, Calif.; Debbie Rosenberg of New Rochelle, N.Y.; and Janice Seamon-Molson of Hollywood, Fla.

title: Calculating Luck
description: For many regular lottery players, how they choose their numbers is important  whether its picking digits with personal meaning or asking a stranger on the street.

title: On UConns Bench, a Little Size in Reserve
description: STORRS, Conn.  Heather Buck had an ice bag on her left ankle but a smile on her face late Tuesday as she sat on a couch in the locker room, nibbling a snack. She is playing again for the Connecticut womens basketball team, and she is determined to help out any way she can.

title: Cleanliness Is Next to Politics
description: New York state senators are migratory creatures. When the Legislature is in session, they tend to spend half the week in Albany and half the week at home in their districts. For Senator Diane J. Savino, 46, a Democrat who represents parts of Staten Island and Brooklyn, Sunday is a day of transition. She wakes up in Staten Island and heads to Albany in time to have dinner with her boyfriend and fellow Democratic senator, Jeffrey D. Klein, and, often, a group of other legislators. ELIZABETH A. HARRIS

title: A Print Devotee Scoops the Competition in France
description: PARIS

title: Uranium Processor Still Optimistic About Nuclear Industry
description: OTTAWA  On the same day earlier this month that the Canadian company Cameco, a global leader in uranium mining and processing, gathered its executives from around the world for a strategic planning session, news broke of Japans staggering earthquake.

title: With Love. Please Forward.
description: JOANNA REYES reached into her mailbox and pulled out a wrinkled postcard from California. Its fading words, scrawled on a yellowing backdrop, were meant to lure a lonely young woman by the heartstrings thousands of miles to where the grass was greener.

title: Chronicle of a Changing City
description: DUANE READE ranks pretty high on the list of character-killing (if useful) additions to a neighborhood. But the Duane Reade that opened this month on Broadway at 72nd Street has an unusual distinction: It is the second in the city with a beer counter, called Brew York City. Its not quite a bar, because the not-quite-a-bartender who stands behind it cant pour glasses of beer for customers to sip while filling prescriptions or perusing the shampoo selection. Instead, he sells growlers, refillable glass bottles, for $3.99. And for $7.99, he fills them with one of nine varieties of beer on tap, like Sixpoint Sweet Action or Ithaca Apricot Wheat. Last year, a Duane Reade in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, became the citys first with a beer counter. It was such a hit, said Richard Ruiz, the Broadway stores manager, that it is being repeated. Everyone slows down when they pass this section, said Julio Vega, who was manning the counter one recent afternoon. Across the aisle: bags full of potato chips and pretzels.

title: Answers to Questions About New York City
description: A Soldier and a Mayor

title: Hosni Mubaraks Shadow Still Falls Over Egypt
description: CAIRO  Amid the myriad public interest lawsuits filed against the deposed government of Hosni Mubarak, the volume of which is beginning to rival the flow of the Nile, the attorney Samir Sabry contributed a novel ripple.

title: Preserving Mubarak
description: The question of how to treat public remnants of Mubarak's name and image is causing a noisy debate in the streets and courthouses of Egypt.

title: Budget Impasse Increasing Risk of U.S. Shutdown
description: WASHINGTON  With time running short and budget negotiations this week having reached an angry impasse, Congressional leaders are growing increasingly pessimistic about reaching a bipartisan deal that would avert a government shutdown in early April.

title: Bloggingheads: Pro-Gay and Pro-Life
description: Robert Jones, left, of Public Religion Research Institute and Michele Dillon of the University of New Hampshire discuss public opinion about abortion and same-sex marriage.

title: Fasten Your Seat Belts
description: THERES nothing inherently sexy about taxis  those yellow, pothole-seeking, over-abundant (except in the rain) facts of city life. But a lot of romance seems to occur within and around them. The following poems about cabs were found last week in the Missed Connections section of newyork.craigslist.org. They are printed verbatim, with only line and stanza breaks added; the titles are the subject headings. ALAN FEUER

title: Classic Cowboys, Back on the Range
description: SONY PICTURES HOME ENTERTAINMENT is now making its collection of manufactured-on-demand discs, Screen Classics by Request, available through Amazons CreateSpace program as well as directly from Sony. This should make Sonys eclectic assembly of some 125 comparatively obscure titles from its Columbia Pictures library more accessible to collectors. Its an excellent initiative.

title: Canadian Government, Beset by Scandal, Collapses
description: OTTAWA  Canadas Conservative government fell Friday when opposition parties voted it in contempt of Parliament, accusing it of failing to disclose accurate cost figures for key programs.

title: Going West Suits Connecticut
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  At 68, Connecticut Coach Jim Calhoun is no longer a young man. But he will continue to go west at every opportunity in the N.C.A.A. tournament.

title: Looking Ahead to Saturdays Games
description: West

title: My Liz: The Fantasy
description: The setting is the Starlight Roof or whatever it is or was called, at the top of what to me will always be The RCA Building; just as the MetLife Building remains The Pan Am Building. (I resist all alterations to my adopted city.)

title: Events in Westchester
description: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around the Hudson Valley. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com, or by mail to Westchester Calendar, Metropolitan, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018-1405.

title: Events on Long Island
description: Music and Dance

title: Events in Connecticut
description: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Connecticut. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com, or by mail to Connecticut Calendar, Metropolitan, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018-1405.

title: Events in New Jersey
description: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state. Items may be submitted by mail to New Jersey Calendar, Metropolitan, The New York Times, 620 Eighth Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10018-1405; or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: The Bruins Percentage Player
description: WILMINGTON, Mass.  Tim Thomas, the Boston Bruins goalie and the best player at his position in the N.H.L. this season, was taking off his gear in the empty dressing room Friday when he was asked about breaking Dominik Haseks record for the highest single-season save percentage.

title: G.M. to Resume Production in Shreveport, La., as Others Assess Situation
description: DETROIT  General Motors said on Friday that it would resume production at a Louisiana pickup truck plant that had been idled this week because of low supplies of a Japanese-made part.

title: Judge in Italy Puts Off Ruling in Dolce & Gabbana Case
description: MILAN  An Italian judge here postponed until April 1 a decision on whether the celebrity designers Domenico Dolce and Stefano Gabbana should be tried on criminal charges of tax evasion and fraud.

title: Judge Upholds $7,000 Fine in Trampling at Wal-Mart
description: An administrative law judge on Friday upheld a $7,000 fine against Wal-Mart Stores that the United States Occupational Safety and Health Administration had imposed after a Wal-Mart employee was trampled to death at a Long Island store on Black Friday 2008.

title: China: Cutting Frills From Junkets
description: The central government in Beijing is tightening budgets for overseas junkets, receptions and cars to fight against extravagance in 2011, according to a report by Xinhua, the state news agency. The report indicated that government corruption continued to be a major concern among Chinese, and that some in the central government realize the ubiquitous image of corrupt officialdom is eroding the confidence of Chinese people. Xinhua, citing a meeting on Wednesday of the State Council, the Chinese cabinet, said that the central government would report the final budget for those expenses to the National Peoples Congress, a rubber-stamp legislature, and make the accounting available for public scrutiny. Xinhua cited one official saying a crackdown on extravagant spending had saved the nation nearly $900 million last year. It is unclear whether such crackdowns have really had any significant impact on corruption and waste.

title: Fallout? The Ocean Isnt Empty Space
description: To the Editor:

title: San Diego State Star Stays Quiet on N.B.A.
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  Kawhi Leonard is not overly talkative when times are good.

title: Safely Back, a Pilot Tells of His Raid Over Libya
description: As Capt. Ryan Thulin steered his F-16 fighter jet over the central Libyan coast early last Sunday, he peered into the inky darkness to hunt his target: Libyan tanks, artillery and other fielded forces.

title: A Longer, and Safer, Life
description: To the Editor:

title: Just One Word: Plastics
description: To the Editor:

title: Arizonas Williams Saves His A-Game for, Well, Games
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  When Kemba Walker and his Connecticut teammates take the floor against Arizona on Saturday in a Round of 8 matchup, they should hope to see the practice version of Derrick Williams.

title: A Love Letter to Detroit, From a Believer
description: To the Editor:

title: Catholic Order Reaches $166 Million Settlement With Sexual Abuse Victims
description: SEATTLE  A Roman Catholic religious order in the Northwest has agreed to pay $166 million to more than 500 victims of sexual abuse, many of whom are American Indians and Alaska Natives who were abused decades ago at Indian boarding schools and in remote villages, lawyers for the plaintiffs said Friday.

title: The Internship as Inside Track
description: WANT to land a full-time job after college? Get an internship or two, or even four or more.

title: Freshman Eases the Pain His Father Caused Calhoun
description: ANAHEIM, Calif.  Only in the small, insular world of college basketball could something like this happen  Rolando Lamb and Jeremy Lamb and Jim Calhoun are connected by 27 years, three schools and one buzzer-beater none of them will forget.

title: Fire Thats Not in Name Only
description: Firefighters are known for putting out fires, of course, but the N.Y. Firehouse Grille is out to create a few of its own.

title: A Menu That Covers a Lot of Asian Territory
description: CAN there be too many Asian-style restaurants opening in the county? Not if theyre good.

title: Japans Lessons for U.S. Nuclear Power
description: To the Editor:

title: Global Supply Lines at Risk as Shipping Lines Shun Japan
description: HONG KONG  The economic disruptions from Japans crisis have cascaded into another, crucial link in the global supply chain: cargo shipping.

title: State Weighs Tax Change for Giant Financial Firm
description: Even for the worlds largest asset manager, every million counts.

title: Spices to Expand the Palate
description: A shop devoted entirely to spices might seem too small a niche to those who have never tried to make, say, tahchin, an Iranian chicken-and-rice casserole, without Persian saffron.

title: A Full-Flavored Taste of the Middle East
description: THE hummus was good. The baba ghanouj was better. But it was the tabbouleh that sold me on El Sham, a Syrian restaurant of tiny proportions, big flavors and bargain prices tucked into a utilitarian strip mall in Hamilton.

title: McLaren Fastest at the First Practice Session of the Season  and Other Surprises
description: The seasons first day of practice sessions took place in Melbourne on Friday, and despite a lot of rain in recent days, they were held mostly on a dry track  until the end of the second session, when there were what Mark Webber of the Red Bull team referred to as some Melbourne showers. While it is difficult to see in Friday practice sessions who are the powers that be, if we take the time sheets at face value there are a few surprises.

title: McLaren Fastest at the First Practice Session of the Season  and Other Surprises
description: The seasons first day of practice sessions took place in Melbourne on Friday, and despite a lot of rain in recent days, they were held mostly on a dry track  until the end of the second session, when there were what Mark Webber of the Red Bull team referred to as some Melbourne showers. While it is difficult to see in Friday practice sessions who are the powers that be, if we take the time sheets at face value there are a few surprises.

title: Silicon Valley Hiring Perks: Meals, iPads and a Cubicle for Spot
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Eric Firestone began a new job at a Web start-up here three weeks ago, and hes already thinking about what he might do next. But thats just fine with his new employer.

title: A Name Selected for the Nose
description: The francophile portfolio of Bouk Wines has broadened with the addition of a white called Perlant. In France, a wine designated perlant has a tiny sparkle.

title: Prosecution Requests Granted in Priests Abuse Case
description: PHILADELPHIA  In a blistering courtroom session on Friday, the judge overseeing the case involving priests accused in the sexual abuse scandal in the Philadelphia Archdiocese granted the prosecutions request to bypass a preliminary hearing and scheduled arraignment for April 15.

title: A Place Where the Seafood Rules
description: PRIME CATCH, a four-month-old restaurant in Rockville Centre, has a name that might have potential customers wondering, is this a steak house with seafood or a fish house with prime meats?

title: Two Teams, but All Eyes on Messi
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The little guy wearing the sky blue and white striped jersey of Argentina will be the center of attention in an international friendly match against the United States at New Meadowlands Stadium on Saturday night.

title: Regional Italian, by Day and Night
description: THE difference was apparent from the moment the bread basket arrived. During an enjoyable lunch at Tappo, an Italian restaurant in downtown Stamford that opened last October, the fresh Tuscan bread had been crusty, with a light, textured interior; at a weeknight dinner it tasted store-bought. Given that the unfiltered extra-virgin olive oil accompanying the bread  made with Coratina olives, our waiter said  was excellent both times of day, I would have considered the bread an exception, a slow-night slip-up. But then came the fried baby artichokes. Stippled with fresh parsley and sheer shavings of Grana Padano, they had been crisp and full of flavor at lunch; at dinner the dish was listless.

title: Where to Be Good, and Bad
description: Much of the retail space inside A Little Something Bakery is occupied by an L-shaped display case and the six-person staff busily filling orders and icing cakes around it. But a half-dozen chairs have been squeezed into the front of this homey little shop, which has a frosting-pink interior and morning glories painted on its plate glass windows.

title: Wal-Mart Tries a Refined Path Into New York
description: It persuaded the makers of All laundry detergent to shrink their bottles by more than half to generate less waste. It got thousands of farmers to stop using pesticides. And it encouraged millions of consumers to dump incandescent light bulbs in favor of energy-sipping compact fluorescents.

title: Head of College Board to Depart Next Year
description: Gaston Caperton, who as president of the College Board is the ultimate proctor of the SAT and Advanced Placement exams, announced Friday that he would step down in June 2012. Mr. Caperton, 71, a former Democratic governor of West Virginia, has led the College Board since 1999. A search for his successor is expected to begin soon, the board said. Mr. Caperton has presided over a period of enormous growth at the College Board, as the number of students who took one of its exams or its courses grew to over 7 million last year, compared with 3 million in 1999, the organization said. Among his accomplishments, the board said, was tripling the number of low-income students who took at least one Advanced Placement course. In that time, though, the SAT has lost ground to its chief rival, the ACT, a college entrance exam that tends to measure more of what students learn in the classroom than the SAT, which can be more of a yardstick of analytical skills.

title: Charter School Champion Shifts Focus
description: Green Dot, the schools group based in Los Angeles that challenged conventional practices by staffing its charter schools with unionized teachers, is going through a divorce with its founder, Steve Barr, who is leaving to build a new national charter group.

title: An Actors Story, Retold Onstage
description: A year before his apparent suicide in 2004, Spalding Gray, the acclaimed writer and performer known for his narrative monologues, appeared at the Emelin Theater in Mamaroneck to present his latest work. Now, Mr. Gray returns  in words and disarming spirit  when the Emelin stages Spalding Gray: Stories Left to Tell, a play composed of excerpts from his letters, journals and published writings.

title: The Pride of Connersville Is the Soul of Butler
description: NEW ORLEANS  Linda Howard and her husband raised 10 children in rural Connersville, Ind., on Stan Howards salary as a mail carrier. Stan Howard has taken only one sick day in 33 years from his 10-mile route, and that day he was sent home against his will. The Howards lived in a three-bedroom house until Matt was about 5, with use of the lone bathroom designated by appointment.

title: A Towns Self-Image Gets a Theatrical Lift
description: WHEN Jackie Dempsey, 44, a co-artistic director of

title: A Czech Artist Explores Memories of New York
description: PEEKSKILL, N.Y.

title: Reviewing the Fiat 500
description: In Sundays Automobiles section, Jerry Garrett reviews the Fiat 500, the first new model from the Italian brand to make American landfall in 25 years. Whereas Fiats exported to the United States in the 70s and 80s would sooner spend time in the shop than accelerating through the apex of a mountain curve, the 500 felt light and sporting in Mr. Garretts hands:

title: Stories of Isolation in an Urban Circus
description: Optimists are stupid people, snaps a caustic subway motorman to his congenitally cheerful trainee  not coincidentally nicknamed Happy  in Aditi Brennan Kapils Agnes Under the Big Top.

title: With $30,000 for Graduation Talk, Rutgers Joins Colleges Paying Speakers
description: On May 15, the Nobel Prize-winning novelist Toni Morrison will give the commencement address at Rutgers University in New Jersey. For her trouble, she will receive an honorary doctorate of letters  and a check for $30,000.

title: 4 Pieces of the Past That Face Danger
description: THEY are pieces of Long Islands past in danger of dissolving: an elegant hotel that was meant to transform Huntington into an urban destination in 1929; a jazz legends 1952 tract house in Dix Hills where music history was made; a time capsule farm in Commack dating to 1860; a Copiague neighborhood created in 1926 to conjure the romance of Venice, complete with gondolas and columns topped by flying lions.

title: A Furrier Closes Shop
description: Manhattan Furrier is closing after 95 years in the same store in Greenpoint, Brooklyn.

title: Its the Final Sale for a Longtime Furrier
description: The door opened into a space stuck in another century, a dingy, narrow store inhabited for six decades by Irving Feller, his art and his animals on hangers: minks, rabbits, skunks, Spanish lambs and beady-eyed stone martens with tiny claws going nowhere fast.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: March 25, 2011

title: Southern Lawmakers Focus on Illegal Immigrants
description: Some of the toughest bills in the nation aimed at illegal immigrants are making their way through legislatures in the South.

title: Renovating a Home and a Father-Son Relationship
description: Maybe everyone who left home to live in a big city has had a fantasy something like John Marcheses. A single freelance writer in New York, Mr. Marchese decided to buy and completely renovate a house somewhere near his hometown, Scranton, Pa., where his parents still lived.

title: Remembering the Dead as They Were
description: The dead are marching over the hills behind us. Here comes Raymond Otts grandfather, Andrew Ott, born around 1881 and dead nearly 40 years. He was 6-foot-3 and filled the doorway, Mr. Ott said. He signed up for the Navy when he was 13. He came back to New York to work as a firefighter with Engine 20 on Lafayette Street in Lower Manhattan. A century ago, he watched from near the corner of Greene Street and Washington Place as young women and men dropped from the sky, escaping fire on the ninth floor of the Triangle shirtwaist factory.

title: Pelfrey Expects At-Bats to Be Better, No Matter How Few and Far Between
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  With a career batting average of .094, Mike Pelfrey has no illusions of winning the Triple Crown. He generally hopes only to make productive outs by moving runners over, because it has been a long time since Pelfrey has done anything of note with a bat. A very long time.

title: Where the Paths to Love and Freedom Cross
description: For worshipers of Stephen Sondheim, it is all about the music. You know you are in the hands of a genius when frenzy and frolic is rhymed with strictly symbolic, and tunics with eunuchs.

title: Census Apparently Did Check Behind Every Tree
description: As the possibilities multiplied, so did the sense of mystery. Maybe they were homeless people; the Census Bureau was not sure. Perhaps they were municipal workers who lived above a maintenance shed; parks officials said it was impossible. City planners were stumped, too.

title: Free Speech Worth Paying For
description: ON Monday, the Supreme Court will consider its first campaign-finance challenge since Citizens United v. Federal Election Commission, the 2010 ruling that permits corporations and unions to spend as much as they wish to promote or defeat political candidates. Based on Citizens United, it might appear that the court would be inclined to wipe away all regulation of campaign finance. But that view would be mistaken.

title: A Love, Updated, but Still Tragic
description: Its late at night. A 14-year-old girl is standing on the balcony outside her bedroom, talking to herself about the great guy she met earlier that night at a party. Suddenly she hears a voice. Oh, no, the guy is here, just below her balcony. Naturally shes horrified. She screams and tries to hide.

title: Whats in a Nickname?
description: Our question for today is: How do the potential Republican presidential nominees stack up on Libya?

title: Wal-Mart Ad Features a Soldiers Story
description: This 30-second television spot, titled From Soldier to Wal-Mart Store Manager, is part of Wal-Marts campaign to open its first stores in New York City. The advertisement began appearing in the city in mid-February. Wal-Mart would not say how much it has spent on its New York advertising campaign.

title: Saturday: Scaled-Back Thing
description: SATURDAYS PUZZLE  May I offer you some 1 Across and a nice glass of 1 Down? You may need the sustenance. This is a tough puzzle but a well-constructed one, as Brad Wilbers puzzles tend to be.

title: Losing Our Way
description: So here we are pouring shiploads of cash into yet another war, this time in Libya, while simultaneously demolishing school budgets, closing libraries, laying off teachers and police officers, and generally letting the bottom fall out of the quality of life here at home.

title: Kansas Crushes the Magic Out of Richmond
description: SAN ANTONIO  Maybe the top-seeded Kansas Jayhawks just needed something to inspire them as they strolled down what might be considered the smoothest road to the Final Four in tournament history.

title: Detroit Neighborhood Fights Flight
description: Residents of a collection of Detroit neighborhoods called Grandmont Rosedale struggle to hold their community together.

title: Trying to Save a City, or at Least a Part
description: DETROIT  In a city where residents are still fleeing at a historic rate, there is no shortage of clichd reminders that this place has been redefined by abandonment: crumbling factories, blocks filled with boarded-up houses, and empty streets overgrown with weeds.

title: A Shabby Crusade in Wisconsin
description: The latest technique used by conservatives to silence liberal academics is to demand copies of e-mails and other documents. Attorney General Kenneth Cuccinelli of Virginia tried it last year with a climate-change scientist, and now the Wisconsin Republican Party is doing it to a distinguished historian who dared to criticize the states new union-busting law. These demands not only abuse academic freedom, but make the instigators look like petty and medieval inquisitors.

title: Arizonas Boon to Free Speech
description: In two consolidated cases on Monday, the Supreme Court will hear argument about an Arizona law that levels the playing field in state elections, by a public financing mechanism called triggered matching funds. These funds support, expand and promote political speech, carrying out a central purpose of the First Amendment.

title: Change in Yemen
description: There may have been a time when Yemens president, Ali Abdullah Saleh, could have maneuvered a more graceful departure from the office he has held for three decades. But he has lost his legitimacy and should go as quickly as possible. Continued instability is not good for Yemen or for the United States-led fight against Al Qaeda.

title: In Packed Districts, Lists for a School Spot Grow
description: Steve Kreps and his wife, Harlene, had a plan for their son, Reuben.

title: One Hundred Years of Multitude
description: One hundred years ago, during the last great American conniption over immigration, the United States government went to unheard-of effort and expense to peer deep into the bubbling melting pot to find out, as this paper put it, just what is being melted.

title: The Shame of New Yorks Group Homes
description: Nearly four decades ago, amid repeated scandals, New York State closed the huge state hospitals that essentially warehoused the developmentally disabled. Now, an investigation by The Times has shown that New Yorks group homes for the disabled  thousands of widely dispersed, state-licensed residences that were intended to replace and mitigate the cruelty of the warehouses  have themselves gone to rot.

title: Butler Center Expected to Play
description: NEW ORLEANS  As Matt Howard has developed from a back-to-basket post-up player to more of a face-up power forward for Butler, a critical part of that evolution has been the play of the sophomore center Andrew Smith.

title: Tar Heels Prevail By Early Decision
description: NEWARK  The Marquette players appeared to be shooting at a moving target. So Coach Buzz Williams called his second timeout in about two minutes and strode out to the free-throw line, as if he wanted to try to play offense for his flustered players.

title: Corrections
description: EDITOR'S NOTE

title: New Dispute in Wisconsin: Is Workers Law in Effect?
description: CHICAGO  A law to limit collective bargaining rights for public workers in Wisconsin was unexpectedly published by a state agency on Friday despite a temporary restraining order barring publication, sparking confusion and more animosity among legislators who have fiercely debated the issue for weeks.

title: Reads & Reactions
description: In this edition of Reads & Reactions: a model back-and-forth, salad economics, a Palin candidacy, Libya, a few helpings of March Madness and comments from FiveThirtyEight readers.

title: Cyclist Dies After Being Run Over by Bus
description: March 26 | Update  The bus and its driver were located Saturday. Read more here.

title: "From the Fire"
description: A clip of "From the Fire," which tells the story of the Triangle Shirtwaist Factory blaze that killed 146 workers in 1911. (Erica Min)

title: Mexicans in the Catholic Church
description: Mexican immigrants have brought an intense faith and a youthful energy to the Roman Catholic Church in the United States.

title: For the Knicks, Losing Is Fast Becoming a Way of Life
description: The Knicks needed a victory on Friday more for the mental lift it would give them than for the effect it would have on their slipping position in the playoff chase. They again put themselves in position to win but again unraveled in the fourth quarter, their stopping point in so many recent games and the reason for so many recent losses.

title: Despite Allied Airstrikes, Crackdown Keeps Tense Peace in Tripoli
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  As allied airstrikes pound the military forces of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, rebels in eastern Libya and politicians in Western capitals are watching closely for signs that residents in the colonels stronghold of Tripoli will rise up to drive him from power.

title: Playing the Subways
description: Luis Tigre is part of a growing community of  Mexican subway musicians who are entertaining riders with Norteo music.

title: Wisconsin Professors E-Mails Are Target of G.O.P. Records Request
description: As Wisconsins capital continued to echo with debate over the controversial legislation that strips public unions of collective bargaining rights, a history professor at the University of Wisconsin in Madison publicly joined the conversation last week with his first post on a new blog.

title: Its Tracking Your Every Move and You May Not Even Know
description: A favorite pastime of Internet users is to share their location: services like Google Latitude can inform friends when you are nearby; another, Foursquare, has turned reporting these updates into a game.

title: Photo Replay: March 25
description: The day in sports from the courts of March Madness to the fields of spring training.

title: Kentucky Climbs as Another No. 1 Falls
description: NEWARK  By the time Ohio State took the court late Friday night, Coach Thad Matta and his No. 1-seeded Buckeyes had seen many office-pool darlings eliminated from the N.C.A.A. tournament, chilling reminders of the madness of March.

title: Newly Homeless Re-Establish Order
description: Evacuees applied for temporary housing after the tsunami and earthquake in Japan.

title: V.C.U. Continues Its Unlikely Run
description: SAN ANTONIO  With a wild, 72-71 overtime victory against Florida State, Virginia Commonwealth continued its unlikely dash through an N.C.A.A. tournament that many thought the Rams did not deserve to attend.

title: U.N.s Nuclear Chief Says Japan Is Far From the End
description: The worlds chief nuclear inspector said Saturday that Japan was still far from the end of the accident that struck its Fukushima nuclear complex and continues to spew radiation into the atmosphere and the sea, and acknowledged that the authorities were still unsure about whether the reactor cores and spent fuel were covered with the water needed to cool them and end the crisis.

title: Nocturnalist | A Night to Peer at the Heavens
Vettel Dominates First Qualifying of the Season
description: Saying that it was a surprise to see Sebastian Vettel score the pole position today in Melbourne at the first qualifying session of the year would not be accurate. On the other hand, judging by the sounds of peoples reactions to just how blisteringly fast the reigning world champion went and by how much he destroyed the competition, few people expected such domination.

title: Vettel Dominates First Qualifying of the Season
description: Saying that it was a surprise to see Sebastian Vettel score the pole position today in Melbourne at the first qualifying session of the year would not be accurate. On the other hand, judging by the sounds of peoples reactions to just how blisteringly fast the reigning world champion went and by how much he destroyed the competition, few people expected such domination.

title: NATO Airstrike in Afghanistan Kills 7 Civilians, Including 3 Children
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A NATO airstrike targeting Taliban fighters Friday accidentally killed seven civilians, including three children, in the southern province of Helmand, one of the most insecure regions in the country, Afghan officials said.

title: The Weekend Word: On Message
description: Todays Times

title: How Much Does It Cost to Run for President?
description: How much does it cost to run for president?

title: Classic Ad: Fiat Gets a Lift From Mentos
Airstrikes Clear Way for Libyan Rebels First Major Advance
description: AJDABIYA, Libya  Col. Muammar el-Qaddafis forces retreated from this strategic city on Saturday, running for dozens of miles back along the coast with Libyan rebels in pursuit in their first major victory since American and European airstrikes began a week ago.

title: An Idea to Spice Up the N.F.L.s Extra Point
description: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iqaXOT0M8qM

title: Three New Books Highlight Female Entrepreneurship
description: Recently, I came across three new books that explore very different female entrepreneurship experiences. In The Dressmaker of Khair Khana, Gayle Tzemach Lemmon, who has an M.B.A. from Harvard and extensive experience writing about female entrepreneurs in war zones, tells the story of Kamila Sidiqi, who built a thriving dressmaking business in Afghanistan while living under Taliban rule.

title: Libyan Woman Struggles to Tell Media of Her Rape
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  A Libyan woman burst into the hotel housing the foreign press in Tripoli on Saturday morning in an attempt to tell journalists that she had been raped and beaten by members of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafis militia. After struggling for nearly an hour to resist removal by Colonel Qaddafis security forces,  she was dragged away from the hotel screaming.

title: The Financial Hurdles Gay Couples Face
description: I profiled a lesbian couple, Amanda and Kay Shelton, for our special section Money Through the Ages. The Sheltons home is pretty typical of many American couples in their thirties raising two young children  toys in the basement, baby monitors, requests for chocolate milk from little people.

title: Worse Is Better
description: Wow. The GOP prescription for higher employment is actually quite spectacular  its a thing of many levels, an ignorance wrapped in a fallacy.

title: Airlines Offer Miles to Red Cross Donors
description: If the scenes of the devastation from the tsunami and earthquake and nuclear crises werent enough to motivate you to give to the Red Cross relief efforts, United and Continental Airlines have come up with another enticement: frequent flier miles.

title: The Talented Mr. Romney
description: Right now, former Governor Mitt Romney is considered the favorite to win the Republican nomination. Bettors at Intrade, a political futures market, estimate that he has a 24 percent chance of doing so, just ahead of Tim Pawlenty, who has a 19 percent chance.

title: For U.S., Double, Triple Deutsch
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Bob Bradley, the coach of the United States national team, is probably thinking long and hard about getting the only two uncapped players on his roster into Saturday nights match against Argentina. If not then, then certainly Tuesdays game against Paraguay.

title: The Weeks Business News in Pictures.
description: Photographs of the weeks news and features in business.

title: Canadians Schedule Vote for May 2
description: OTTAWA  Prime Minister Stephen Harper said Saturday that Canadians would vote on May 2, the shortest possible campaign period under the countrys laws.

title: Variety: A Random Acrostic
description: SECOND SUNDAY PUZZLE  There are three types of lies: lies, damn lies and statistics. That quote has been attributed to Mark Twain and Benjamin Disraeli, among others. I used to work in advertising research, so I know it well.

title: Dangers of Radiation for Workers at Fukushima Daiichi
description: Inside the buildings of the damaged reactors at Fukushima Daiichi, workers attempting to make repairs are facing dangerous risks from radiation exposure.

title: Defining a Refuge as Resource Thirsts Rise
description: 4:53 p.m. | Updated On Saturday, I participated in a TEDx event focused on the future of Americas century-old National Wildlife Refuge system, with a special focus on the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge on the North Slope of Alaska. The video is archived above. [You can scan my live blogging below.]

title: Tension and Grief in Syria After Protests and Deadly Reprisals
description: CAIRO  Violence continued to plague Syria on Saturday, as government forces killed more demonstrators in Latakia, protesters burned offices of the ruling party in the south and west, and mourners throughout the country buried the dozens of unarmed protesters killed a day earlier.

title: Last Word: Geraldine A. Ferraro
description: In 1984, Geraldine A. Ferraro became the first woman nominated for national office by a major party.

title: Sullinger Pledges Allegiance to Ohio State
description: NEWARK  Ohio States crushing 62-60 loss to Kentucky in the Round of 16 on Friday was eased somewhat  and at least temporarily  by Jared Sullingers announcement afterward that he would return to Columbus next season.

title: Women Activists Tortured in Egypt
description: From Cairo, the Op-Ed columnist Nicholas D. Kristof reports that pro-democracy activists have been arrested and tortured.

title: Note to Banks: Its Not 2006 Anymore
description: NOSTALGIA is running high on Wall Street for the days when junk mortgage underwriting and opaque derivatives trading juiced bank profits. As regulators continue to devise the machinery of the Dodd-Frank regulatory reform law, major financial institutions are working overtime in Washington to bring the good times back again.

title: A Coaching Tree Blooms
description: TEMPE, Ariz.  Hiring a coach, Bill Stoneman says, should be no different from scouting players. You see what they are while projecting what they might become. Playing prospects might grow into superstars. Coaching prospects might become managers.

title: Goal for One Team Is Impossible Dream for the Other
description: Everything is relative. In the very same city, Yankees fans are generally happy only if their team wins the World Series whereas Mets fans are conditioned to be happy with one magical season every generation or so  although not this year. Absolutely not this year.

title: Athletics and Rays Build What Theyre Able To
description: The great stadium building boom began in the American League, with a flurry of grass-and-dirt ballparks sprouting in the early 1990s. From the South Side of Chicago to the railyards in Baltimore to the heart of downtown Cleveland and a parking lot in Arlington, Tex., nearly everyone was moving out and moving up  or, at least, remodeling their existing homes.

title: AT&T Lobbyist Faces Beltway Test in T-Mobile Deal
description: Washington

title: The Names Change, but the Complaints Dont
description: MEMBERSHIP has its privileges.

title: Whats the Mission? Your Troops Want to Hear It From You
description: This interview with  Doreen Lorenzo, president of Frog Design, an innovation firm in San Francisco, was conducted and condensed by  Adam Bryant.

title: A Budding Branch of Scioscias Tree
description: PEORIA, Ariz.  Among the 30 major league managers, only Tony La Russa of the Cardinals has been in his job longer than the Angels Mike Scioscia, who starts his 12th season. Scioscia has won five American League West titles since his greatest triumph, the 2002 World Series championship, when his coaching staff had to rank as baseballs best.

title: Its 2026, and the Debt Is Due
A Bounce Isnt Enough to Recover From a Bubble
description: DESPITE recent volatility in global markets, domestic stocks have doubled in value in the last two years, the fastest such gain since the Great Depression.

title: In a New Web World, No Application Is an Island
description: THE Web is poised for a comeback.

title: Pointing With Your Eyes, to Give the Mouse a Break
description: ON a handful of prototype PCs, your look is your command.

title: In Hollywood, a Decade of Hits Is No Longer Enough
description: FOR the last 12 years, Alan F. Horns movie operation has printed money for Warner Brothers, the largest of Hollywoods studios.

title: A Career in Tabloids, Thanks to Elizabeth Taylor
description: ELIZABETH TAYLOR is the reason I became a tabloid reporter.

title: Hes Got Magic to Do
description: WHEN I was 10, on a family visit with my grandfather in Florida, I told him the kids at school were cheating at cards. He took me to Paul Diamonds Magic Shop in Fort Lauderdale and bought me a deck of marked cards. I got hooked on magic at the store and never used the cards  I was more of a practical joker than a troublemaker. My older brother showed me how magic tricks worked, and I drove my family crazy practicing on them.

title: Libyan Woman Struggles to Tell Her Story
description: A Libyan woman burst into a hotel housing foreign press and fought off security forces to tell how she had been raped and beaten by Qaddafi militia members. (Video via Reuters)

title: Fearless Prediction: Marlins Will Be Unpredictable
description: When the Philadelphia Phillies started their streak of four National League East titles, the Mets were their primary rival. Last season, the Atlanta Braves led the division into September and snagged the wild card. The Washington Nationals have been annual also-rans.

title: She Ended the Mens Club of National Politics
description: Geraldine A. Ferraro, the former Queens congresswoman who strode onto a podium in 1984 to accept the Democratic nomination for vice president and to take her place in American history as the first woman nominated for national office by a major party, died on Saturday in Boston.She was 75.

title: The Endgame in Afghanistan
description: KUNDUZ, Afghanistan   The general arrived late, but in style, bursting into a meeting with American commanders dressed in leather bomber jacket, riding boots and creased corduroys. To his critics, he was a warlord in uniform. But on this February day, he radiated the sly charisma of a congressman on the stump.

title: Freedoms Painful Price
description: CAIRO

title: Elizabeth Taylor: Famous, but on Her Own Terms
description: No one could have been surprised by the flurry of headlines surrounding Elizabeth Taylors death. Ms. Taylor certainly would not have been. She sailed through life on a sea of ink and never seemed in danger of drowning.

title: From Republicans in Iowa, Different Views on Winning in 2012
For Women in Sports, A.C.L. Injuries Take Toll
description: PHILADELPHIA  This is not the homecoming that Caroline Doty wanted, surgical scars having formed a vague T on her left knee, her contribution to Connecticut this season limited to charting plays from the bench instead of leading the team at point guard.

title: Radiations Enduring Afterglow
description: Becquerels, sieverts, curies, roentgens, rads and rems. For all the esoteric nomenclature scientists have devised to parse the effects of nuclear emanations, the unit they so often fall back on is the old-fashioned chest X-ray.

title: To Create a Winner, You Have to Find the Winners
description: Anson Dorrance has coached the North Carolina womens soccer team to 21 national titles since 1979, and he has been more than happy to reveal his secret to success. In his 1996 book, Training Soccer Champions, Dorrance described what he calls the jewel of his program: the competitive caldron. U.N.C. soccer players compete in every aspect of the sport, including the weight room, sprints and drills. Coaches then look for the players with a knack for being on the winning side.

title: Video of Libyan Woman Dragged Away From Foreign Press Corps
description: Updated | Sunday | 1:56 p.m. As our colleague David Kirkpatrick reports, A Libyan woman burst into the hotel housing the foreign press in Tripoli on Saturday morning in an attempt to tell journalists that she had been raped and beaten by members of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafis militia. After struggling for nearly an hour to resist removal by Colonel Qaddafis security forces, she was dragged away from the hotel screaming.

title: For Female Surfers, Challenges Out of the Water
description: Cori Schumacher is the reigning womens world longboard champion, yet she has no major sponsors or endorsements. In fact, she refuses them, and recently decided to boycott the Association of Surfing Professionals World Longboard Tour.

title: Eccentricity Gives Way to Uniformity in Museums
description: MERION, Pa.    After years of bitter legal battles over whether it could be relocated, the Barnes Foundation, one of the countrys most beloved and quirky museums, is finally leaving its idyllic setting in suburban Pennsylvania. By midsummer, the last of its galleries is expected to be packed up for the foundations move to downtown Philadelphia in 2012, and one of Americas unique art experiences will be changed forever.

title: It Isnt Over Until She Says
description: BLOOMFIELD HILLS, Mich.  Alissa Czisny has been working for years on letting go of situations she cannot control, from a string of on-ice disappointments to real-life heartache.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: Spoiled by the All-in-One Gadget
description: AT&Ts announcement last Sunday that it plans to acquire T-Mobile was quickly analyzed to be bad news for consumers. If the merger is approved, rates are likely to go up, not just for T-Mobile customers, but for everyone, as there will then be only three companies carving up the majority of the national mobile market.

title: Sticking Around to Define Kentuckys Win
description: Newark

title: In Tour, U.S. Nuclear Plant Opens Doors to Make Case
description: ATHENS, Ala.  The Tennessee Valley Authority opened the doors to its Browns Ferry nuclear plant on Friday to present perhaps the most detailed case so far that American reactors of the same design and vintage as the ones damaged in Japan do not face the same risks.

title: The Great Language Land Grab
description: When tech companies engage in legal squabbles about who gets to use our everyday words, what are ordinary speakers of the language to make of it all?

title: Laugh Lines
description: JAY LENO

title: Nova and Garcia Complete the Yankees Rotation
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The Yankees ostensibly had a competition for their two vacant rotation spots, but they had a strong sense of whom they liked. As long as Ivan Nova pitched well and Freddy Garcia remained healthy, they would win jobs.

title: Fighting Words
description: Prime Minister Vladimir V. Putin and President Dmitri A. Medvedev of Russia clashed last week over a United Nations resolution authorizing the use of force to protect Libyan civilians from Col. Muammar el-Qaddadis forces.

title: Rebels Claim Ajdabiya as Drama Unfolds in Tripoli
description: Rebels clinched their hold on the east and seized back a key city on Saturday after decisive international airstrikes sent Muammar el-Qaddafis forces into retreat, shedding their uniforms and ammunition as they fled.

title: Vandersloot Leads Gonzaga to First Trip to Round of 8
description: SPOKANE, Wash.  The applause that washed over the Gonzaga senior guard Courtney Vandersloot when she exited the game in the final seconds of the Bulldogs 76-69 victory against Louisville in the third round of the N.C.A.A. tournament on Saturday night was deafening.

title: Fed Official Suggests Early End to Stimulus Effort
description: The Federal Reserve should review the current stimulus effort and consider whether to end it early, said James Bullard, president of the St. Louis Fed. The effort, a second round of so-called quantitative easing, in which the government buys Treasury securities to put downward pressure on long-term interest rates, was announced in November and is scheduled to end in June.

title: A Lifetime of Beauty
description: The business of Este Lauder.

title: In Libya, Only the Latest War at an Embattled Crossroads
description: The southern coast of the Mediterranean, from Morocco to Egypt, where the United States and its allies pounded the forces of Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi of Libya last week, has been fought over for millennia.

title: What Would Este Do?
description: HIGH above Fifth Avenue, near the southern fringe of Central Park, is a shrine to the fickle goddess Beauty.

title: Palestinians Hold Talks on Reconciliation
description: JERUSALEM  President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority met Saturday with officials of Hamas for the first time in a year in an effort to reconcile the two movements whose bitter rivalry has kept the West Bank and Gaza apart and blocked any real hope of Palestinian statehood.

title: Regulating Hits to Head Tests N.H.L. Tradition
description: The debate in the N.H.L. over how to curb concussions is only the latest example of tensions between liberal and traditional forces that have shaped hockey since its beginnings in 19th-century Canada.

title: Shots Fired After Suspect Steers Car Toward Federal Agent
description: A federal undercover drug investigation erupted in gunshots on Friday evening, when a plainclothes agent opened fire on a suspect who steered a sport utility vehicle at him on Manhattans West Side, the authorities said.

title: A Further Note On Deficits and the Printing Press
description: A followup on my printing press post: I think one way to clarify my difference with, say, Jamie Galbraith is this: imagine that at some future date, say in 2017, were more or less at full employment and have a federal deficit equal to 6 percent of GDP. Does it matter whether the United States can still sell bonds on international markets?

title: Rangers Do Just Enough Against the Bruins
description: BOSTON  It was the perfect road game.

title: In Tennessee, Grand Plans for a $750 Million Theme Park Raise Great Doubt
description: SPRING HILL, Tenn.  Earlier this month, at a news conference in a field on the east side of the city, a man named Dennis W. Peterson announced that he was bringing a theme park to the Tennessee countryside.

title: Bill Selfs Knack for Being Liked
description: The first time I saw Bill Self I booed. So did Garth Brooks. Even Bills future wife, Cindy, was not a fan. It was March 10, 1979, at the State Fair Arena in Oklahoma City. Yukon High School played Edmond for the Class 4A state basketball title. Garth and I were juniors at Yukon, and Cindy was a freshman. Self was a sophomore guard for Edmond, which lost, 75-69.

title: I, For One, Do Not Welcome Our Dumb Robot Overlords
description: From the FT: stock in Berkshire Hathaway, Warren Buffets company, jumps every time Anne Hathaway, the actress, gets a lot of media play.

title: Coffee Cups in Hell
description: Its the Mormon moment.

title: Iowa May Turn G.O.P.s Focus to Social Issues
description: DES MOINES  The ailing economy and the Tea Partys demand for smaller government have dominated Republican politics for two years, but a resurgent social conservative movement is shaping the first stage of the presidential nominating contest, complicating the strategy for candidates who prefer to focus on fiscal issues over faith.

title: Looking Ahead to Sundays Games
description: East

title: How Radiation Contamination Can Travel
description: How Radiation Contamination Can Travel

title: Inundated With News, Many Find It Difficult to Keep Up on Libya
description: DENVER  Talk about the fog of war.

title: Inside Information Using X-Ray Scanners
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  The latest technology to make waves in professional golf has nothing to do with clubs or balls  but it does aim X-rays at the athletes who use them.

title: Reader Comments on My Egypt Column
description: My Sunday column is about the way Mubarakism is continuing in Egypt, even without Mubarak. I tell this largely through the story of a young woman who was arrested this month by the army for her political activism, then beaten, given electric shocks, and subjected to a forced virginity exam as a way to humiliate and punish her. These extrajudicial tools of torture and military detention reflect the efforts of the Egyptian armed forces to intimidate democracy activists and prevent the democratic revolution from chipping away at army control.

title: Hoping for Arab Mandelas
description: With Libya, Yemen, Bahrain and Syria now all embroiled in rebellions, it is not an exaggeration to suggest that the authoritarian lid that has smothered freedom in the Arab world for centuries may be coming off all 350 million Arab peoples at once. Personally, I think that is exactly what is going to happen over time. Warm up the bus for all the Arab autocrats  and for you, too, Ahmadinejad. As one who has long believed in the democracy potential for this part of the world, color me both really hopeful and really worried about the prospects.

title: Rich District, Poor District
description: To balance New York States budget, Gov. Andrew Cuomo wants to cut a record $1.5 billion from the $23 billion budget for grades K-12.

title: To Get In, Push Buttons, or Maybe Swipe a Magnet
description: Yeshai M. Kutoff was house-proud, having bought a home in Cleveland Heights, Ohio, for his family of five. And as an Orthodox Jew, he bought push-button locks for the doors  an accommodation for the Sabbath, when many of the devout do not carry keys.

title: F.B.I. Casts Wide Net Under Relaxed Rules for Terror Inquiries, Data Show
description: WASHINGTON  Within months after the Bush administration relaxed limits on domestic-intelligence gathering in late 2008, the F.B.I. assessed thousands of people and groups in search of evidence that they might be criminals or terrorists, a newly disclosed Justice Department document shows.

title: Sunday: I Like Your Thinking
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  Be careful where you put your answers today. You wont want to bump into anything.

title: Alien Life, Coming Slowly Into View
description: Toronto

title: Political Odd Couple, United by Crisis in California Budget
description: SACRAMENTO  They are a constant if unlikely pair these days: the oldest man elected governor of California and the woman who is its youngest budget director, shuttling from office to office as they meet with lawmakers, confer quietly in the Capitol hallways and fend off reporters and lobbyists.

title: Rapes of Women Show Clash of Old and New India
description: GHAZIABAD, India  The young lovers met at a secluded spot next to a field of wheat at the edge of this sprawling suburb of New Delhi, where the timeless India of mustard fields and bullock carts abuts the frantically rising apartment towers of the budding middle class. They went seeking solitude, but instead found themselves at the violent cusp of old India and new.

title: 30 Seconds With Joe Mauer
description: Minnesota catcher Joe Mauer has won three American League batting titles and was the A.L.s most valuable player in 2009. He is the cover athlete for MLB 11 the Show, the new PlayStation game that features 3-D technology. Mauer, 27, who signed an eight-year, $184 million extension with the Twins before last season, was in Manhattan recently to promote the game.

title: Final: U.S. 1, Argentina 1
description: Coverage of the United States national teams exhibition game against Argentina at New Meadowlands Stadium.

title: A Minimum Wage Increase
description: As the nation grapples with a jobs crisis and unemployment hovers near 9 percent, it is easy for policy makers to forget the plight of those who work but earn very little. There are about 4.4 million workers earning the minimum wage or less, according to government statistics. This amounts to about 6 percent of workers paid by the hour. They need a raise.

title: Japanese Rules for Nuclear Plants Relied on Old Science
description: TOKYO  In the country that gave the world the word tsunami, the Japanese nuclear establishment largely disregarded the potentially destructive force of the walls of water. The word did not even appear in government guidelines until 2006, decades after plants  including the Fukushima Daiichi facility that firefighters are still struggling to get under control  began dotting the Japanese coastline.

title: When Cotton Was King
description: Looking forward from the dawn of the American republic, it was easy to assume that slavery would soon fade away. Slaves were primarily used to produce staple crops like tobacco, rice, indigo and sugar, all of which were in decline under competition from the Caribbean. Without these, slavery could not survive.

title: DeMint Says Other Republicans Should Enter 2012 Race
description: DES MOINES  Senator Jim DeMint of South Carolina is not interested in running for the Republican presidential nomination, but he said Saturday that the presumed field might not be sufficient to inspire voters and he would welcome a last-minute entry by another candidate.

title: The Plight of the Young and the Jobless
description: To the Editor:

title: Selanne Has Been There When Ducks Have Needed Him
description: The Anaheim Ducks Web site bears the message This is when it counts. No player in the N.H.L. has taken that slogan more to heart recently than Teemu Selanne, a 40-year-old and an almost-certain Hall of Famer.

description: To the Editor:
